sect2.title: Build requirements
sect2.para: You probably don't want to build upwatch yourself. Most likely you'll grab the RPM packages and issue rpm -Uvh upwatch*rpm. Then skip to Configuration.

But on the other hand: you can build the software yourself. Apart from the normal GNU compilation tools, and the development versions of the above mentioned packages, you'll need the following on your system to build upwatch:

listitem.para: RPM tools, if you want to build RPM's

sect2.para: If you run RedHat, Debian or SuSE, don't forget to install the *-devel packages if there are any.

sect1.title: Compiling upwatch
sect1.para: Just in case you really want to (or need to) compile upwatch yourself, it's pretty easy:
sect1.literallayout: $ tar xzvf upwatch-x.x.tar.gz $ cd upwatch-x.x $ ./configure $ make $ make install
sect1.para: Nothing to it... In case of problems, you're probably missing some library or header files, or they are in unexpected places. Look at the last parts of config.log.
